msItemStruct.note: It is impossible to tell if any ornamentation was used. Six strokes mark off the verses. A circle with several strokes within it and some around it mark off groups of 10 (and perhaps 5) verses.
Pub. status: Published: recto and verso

condition.ab: Fine parchment with traces of the inner margin of the adjoining page. It represents about a third of the width of the page. What is left of each page is in good condition.

layout.ab: On recto and verso: 11 lines each in Arabic
Source of description: On recto and verso: Qur'an

handDesc.p: Small and poor Meccan(?) script, with a very slight slant, the characters written close together in brown ink that has faded somewhat. The script has some characteristics in common with O.I. A6988 and O.I. A7000. Diacritical strokes are used fully and freely and red vowel dots are also used. A red semicircle is used for hamzah in recto 5 and verso 1 & 5. If this hamzah is sounded with an a, the sign is placed above the letter, if with an i, it is placed below the letter. A red horizontal stroke below the line is used for waslah in verso 9, while the same stroke above a letter is used for maddah in verso 4. A red circle is used with the unpointed letters over s in verso 3.
